sentences.english: Zhao Jing Tao, a college student in China, thought of an old saying.
sentences.chinese: 一位中国大学生赵景涛想起了一句古语。

sentences.english: A collection of Mongolian epitaphs of Yuan dynasty translated into Mandarin Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 书中所集之碑文均为译自元代蒙古语的公牍。

sentences.english: The separation-type of sound change is one of the sound changes in the Mongolian language.
sentences.chinese: 离散式音变是蒙古语的一种音变现象。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the old cliche is often true, “Out of sight, out of mind.”
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，古语说的好“久违情疏”。

sentences.english: Qarhan is transliterated from Mongolian and interpreted as the World of Salt.
sentences.chinese: 察尔汗“是蒙古语的音译，意思是”盐的世界。

sentences.english: A large portion of the eastern Salt Lake, Mongolian Qaidam meaning that the salt marshes.
sentences.chinese: 东部为大片盐湖，蒙古语柴达木即盐泽之意。

sentences.english: On the Female Characters in The Secret History of Mongolia;
sentences.chinese: 现存《蒙古秘史》是用汉字标音拼写成的蒙古语本。

sentences.english: and it may be more accurate than we think, according to the researchers at the University of Alabama.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马大学的研究人员认为这句古语也许比我们。

sentences.english: She was 85 years old and the last speaker of Bo, an ancient language of the Andamanese Islands of India.
sentences.chinese: 她85岁，是印度安达曼群岛古语的最后一位发言者。

sentences.english: Hang Gai, an ancient Mongol word.
sentences.chinese: 杭盖，一个古老的蒙古语单词。

sentences.english: The study on Mongolian semantic meaning has a long history.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古语语义研究有悠久的历史，并取得了一定的成就。

sentences.english: It is one of the official languages in Inner Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古语是内蒙古地区的官方语言之一。

sentences.english: Excuse me, what is this sentence in Mongolian?
sentences.chinese: 请问这句话翻译成蒙古语应该怎么说？

sentences.english: There is an old proverb that care is better than cure.
sentences.chinese: 有一句古语说预防疾病比治愈疾病更高超。

sentences.english: The Secret History of Mongols extant was the mongolian volume spelling in Chinese syllable.
sentences.chinese: 现存《蒙古秘史》是用汉字标音拼写成的蒙古语本。

definition: as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
as the proverb says/as they say...
people from ancient times/the ancients/the late (i.e. person who has passed away)
(idiom) complacency leads to loss, modesty brings profit/pride comes before a fall
pinyin: man3 zhao1 sun3 , qian1 shou4 yi4

definition: since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
